candidates.title: fix: remove ahash from the amt
candidates.body:
- A vec is simpler for what we're doing here.
- Ahash needs randmness...

candidates.title: Import serde_bytes in-tree and make it work with arrays
candidates.body:
1. Import `serde_bytes` (really, `cs_serde_bytes`) in-tree. We only need a small fraction of it anyways.
2. Rename to `ipld_bytes` to make it clear that we're not the same as upstream (leaving an alias for backwards compatibility).
3. Extend it to support fixed-sized arrays.

candidates.title: chore: use rust 2021 edition
candidates.body: It's nearly the end of 2022, and there are some nice features (e.g., better format strings).

candidates.title: Update Wasmtime
candidates.body:
(and other deps)

fixes #853

We might as well get this in sooner rather than later.

candidates.title: feat: add network version 18
candidates.body:
- And use it everywhere.
- And remove the test vectors until we get new ones.

candidates.title: fix: compile wasm test actors separately
candidates.body:
Compile each test actor as _either_ a byte blob containing the wasm module, or as a wasm module.

Previously, we'd compile all test actors into the _test_ binary. But really, we only want them compiled into individual wasm binaries. This sort of worked for some reason, but really shouldn't have, as each wasm module exported a non-mangled "invoke" function.

Unfortunately, it looks like it stopped "sort of working" the second @mriise added a _second_ exported function.

candidates.title: feat: f4 address class, embryo actors, and lookup_address
candidates.body:
- Auto-create embryos on send.
- Allow overwriting embryo actors (used by the init actor).
- Record "predictable" addresses in state.
- Add a syscall for retrieving predictable addresses.

candidates.title: feat: add some initialization helpers to the sdk
candidates.body:
This replaces the custom assert macros. Instead of overriding the assert macros, the user would:

1. Call `fvm_sdk::initialize()` at the top of their actor/tests.
2. Use the default `assert` macros.

replaces #660

candidates.title: Update to wasmtime 0.40.1
candidates.body: Backports #875

candidates.title: chore: deps: Update to wasmtime 0.40.1
candidates.body: Closes #852, assuming it doesn't break things.

candidates.title: Release a fvm, shared, sdk, and integration tests v2 alpha
chore: remove version specifier from bundle dev-dependency
candidates.body: Otherwise, crates.io will reject a publish of this crate.

candidates.title: chore: add integration test crate metadata
candidates.body: (needed for publishing)

candidates.title: feat: avoid importing the bundle into the integration tests
candidates.body:
This change:

- Moves the actor "bundle" dependency to the dev dependencies.
- Makes the `Tester` take a "bundle root cid".
- Exports a helper function for importing a bundle into a blockstore.

That way:

1. Users can instantiate integration tests with their _own_ bundle.
2. We can publish the integration testing _framework_ while testing against a dev bundle locally.

candidates.title: fix: downgrade actors to v9 (in the fvm v2 integration tests)
chore: release fvm v2 (alpha.2)
candidates.body: This will let us cut a new fvm_integration_tests release.

candidates.title: fix: correct coverage features
candidates.body:
- 'coverage' is not actually a feature, and should not be used as such.
- 'wasm-coverage' wasn't used anywhere, as far as I could tell.

This caused problems on publish because the `fil_ipld_actor` is a dev dependency, and features can't apply to dev dependencies like that.

candidates.title: chore: configure publish policy for integration test framework
candidates.body:
1. Remove versions from local dev dependencies.
2. Mark said dependencies as "not publishable".

candidates.title: chore: bump to v3
candidates.body: Bumps fvm, fvm_shared, and fvm_sdk to 3-alpha.1.

candidates.title: chore: explicitly enable anyhow backtrace feature
candidates.body: Otherwise, compilation fails. It looks like some other crate was transitively enabling this feature, but not anymore.

candidates.title: chore: release sdk 2.0.0-alpha.2
candidates.body: Looks like I released alpha 1 when we bumped the FVM, so on to alpha 2?

candidates.title: feat: remove actor "type" enum
candidates.body:
Instead:

- Determine type IDs from the manifest itself.
- Built out a manifest datastructure for the actor types we care about.

That way, we can just add more actor types to the builtin actors without having to change the FVM.

candidates.title: feat: release fvm_shared v2 alpha
candidates.body: This will let us release a v1 release/v1 for nv17.

candidates.title: chore: Remove blake2b hashing which was moved to builtin-actors
candidates.body: Relates to https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/issues/91 and https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/pull/577

candidates.title: feat: remove anymap
candidates.body: It's unmaintained and has some soundness issues. We don't really _need_ it, so I've just gone ahead and removed it entirely (re-implementing what we need).

candidates.title: chore: unlink shared from ipld crates
fix: switch to substrate-wasm-builder
candidates.body: This is the upstream crate.

candidates.title: introduce a crypto::recover_secp_public_key syscall.
candidates.body: Supersedes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/pull/627 with a clean diff, refresh from master, and some small changes (check commit log).

candidates.title: Add new accepted hash functions to the `hash` syscall (sha256, keccak256, ripemd160)
candidates.body:
- [x] sha256
- [x] sha3FIPS256 (Keccak256)
- [x] [ripemd160](https://github.com/multiformats/rust-multihash/pull/226) ~~(waiting on new release of rust-multihash)~~
- [x] new integration test for the syscall

candidates.title: backport: update to proofs 12
candidates.body:
Note: this _updates_ shared _here_, because path dependencies... but we're cutting the release on master.

Yeah, all this kind of sucks. But multi-crate workspaces are... yeah.

candidates.title: chore: update proofs
candidates.body: I'm doing this on master first so we can release an fvm_shared here, then I'll backport.

candidates.title: add thread random generation of machine IDs
candidates.body: Getting chain randomness of current epoch is not allowed. Adds `rand` dep for now till better solutions are made.

chosen_pr.body:
(and other deps)

fixes #853

We might as well get this in sooner rather than later.
